docs.lead_paragraph: The bill would have allowed biosimilar versions of biologic drugs to be substituted by pharmacists if the F.D.A. deemed them “interchangeable” with the reference product.

headline.main: Gov. Brown of California Vetoes Biotech Drug Bill
headline.print_headline: Gov. Brown of California Vetoes Biotech Drug Bill

docs.abstract: California Gov Jerry Brown vetoes bill that would have allowed biosimilar versions of biologic drugs to be substituted by pharmacists if Food and Drug Administration deemed them 'interchangeable' with the brand-name reference product.
docs.snippet: The bill would have allowed biosimilar versions of biologic drugs to be substituted by pharmacists if the F.D.A. deemed them “interchangeable” with the reference product.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Jerry Brown said the bill was premature because federal regulators had not even determined the standards governing the cheaper drugs.

headline.main: Governor Vetoes Bill to Limit Use of Generic Drugs in California
headline.print_headline: Governor Vetoes Bill to Limit Use of Generic Drugs in California

docs.snippet: Gov. Jerry Brown said the bill was premature because federal regulators had not even determined the standards governing the cheaper drugs.

docs.lead_paragraph: The high price of commonly used medications for conditions like asthma contributes heavily to health care costs and certainly causes more widespread anguish.

headline.main: The Soaring Cost of a Simple Breath
headline.print_headline: The Soaring Cost of a Simple Breath

docs.abstract: High price of commonly used medications for conditions like asthma, most common chronic disease that affects Americans of all ages, contributes heavily to health care costs; United States spends far more per capita on medicines than other countries, and drugs account for 10 percent of the nation's $2.7 trillion annual health bill (Series: Paying Till It Hurts).
docs.snippet: The high price of commonly used medications for conditions like asthma contributes heavily to health care costs and certainly causes more widespread anguish.

docs.lead_paragraph: The European Parliament, in a move favored by users and producers of electronic cigarettes, voted against regulating the products as medical devices.

headline.main: European Lawmakers Reject Tight Restrictions on E-Cigarettes
headline.print_headline: European Lawmakers Reject Tight Restrictions on E-Cigarettes

docs.abstract: European Parliament scraps proposals by health officials that electronic cigarettes be tightly regulated as medical devices, setting stage for debate in United States over extent of regulation; European lawmakers endorse permissive approach to sale and use of e-cigarettes.
docs.snippet: The European Parliament, in a move favored by users and producers of electronic cigarettes, voted against regulating the products as medical devices.

byline.contributor: Andrew Higgins reported from Strasbourg, France, and Matt Richtel from San Francisco.
byline.original: By ANDREW HIGGINS and MATT RICHTEL
